snippet: It took 17 minutes after Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 disappeared from civilian radar screens for air traffic controllers to raise concerns, according to a government report.
abstract: Malaysian government report shows that seventeen minutes passed after Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 disappeared from radar screens before air traffic controllers in Vietnam and Malaysia raised any concerns; details of delays and miscues are part of preliminary report by Malaysia’s chief inspector of air accidents on investigation into missing jet.

byline.original: By CHRIS BUCKLEY and MICHAEL FORSYTHE

lead_paragraph: It took 17 minutes after Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 disappeared from civilian radar screens for air traffic controllers to raise concerns, according to a government report.

headline.main: 17-Minute Delay Found in Reporting Missing Plane
headline.print_headline: 17-Minute Delay Found in Reporting Missing Plane
